text: Achlya jezoensis is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Shōnen Matsumura in 1927. It is found in Japan,, 1927, Journal of the College of Agriculture, Hokkaido Imperial University of Tokyo 19: 15, pl. 5, fig. 38. China (Heilongjiang, Inner Mongolia), south-eastern Russia and the Korean Peninsula. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1927 Category:Thyatirinae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Achlya jezoensis
